intro: Aerva caudata, commonly known as the slender aerva, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by three-lobed, papery fruit capsules. Aerva caudata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
